# Scale: Melodic in B (Mode: Locrian #2, Shape: G)

## Brief Overview
The Melodic scale in B, also known as the Locrian #2 scale with a shape starting on G, is a unique and exotic scale that can add an interesting flavor to your music. It is derived from the 7th mode of the Melodic Minor scale. This scale features a lowered tonic note compared to the regular Locrian scale, making it sound dark and mysterious.

## Notes and Intervals
The notes in the Melodic scale in B (Locrian #2, G shape) are as follows:
- B, C, Db, Eb, F#, G, A

The intervals for this scale are:
- Root (B)
- Minor 2nd (C)
- Minor 3rd (Db)
- Perfect 4th (Eb)
- Augmented 4th (F#)
- Perfect 5th (G)
- Minor 6th (A)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This scale is not as commonly used as some of the more traditional scales, but it can add a mysterious and exotic touch to your music. It is often employed in jazz, fusion, and progressive rock music to create tension and a sense of dissonance. The Locrian #2 scale can provide a unique and unexpected sound that can take your compositions to a new level.
